sanskrit_verse:
शुचिं देशं विविक्तं च गोमयेनोपलेपयेत् ।
दक्षिणाप्रवणं चैव प्रयत्नेनोपपादयेत् ॥ ३.२०६॥
transliteration:
śuciṃ deśaṃ viviktaṃ ca gomayenopalepayet |
dakṣiṇāpravaṇaṃ caiva prayatnenopapādayet || 3.206||
sph_interpretive_translation: One must prepare a clean and secluded area, anointing it with cow dung, ensuring it slopes towards the south, and arranging it with utmost care.
jurisprudential_principles: Restoration logic through conscious spatial alignment
supreme_court_application: In matters concerning sacred site establishment or ritual infrastructure, the Court shall mandate compliance with directional, material, and spatial axioms as defined by Dharma Śāstra. The threshold of responsibility lies in demonstrable alignment with śuci-vivikta-gomaya-dakshina parameters.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa is established through sensory and spatial verification; anupūrvaśaḥ manifests in sequential acts of purification, placement, and orientation; proportional responsibility aligns with the degree of deviation from śuci-dakshina-vivikta alignment; reality remains non-punitive as correction flows from natural dharma rather than imposed penalty.
final_declaration: By the Authority of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this Dharma stands executed. The land is purified, the direction honored, the space sanctified. Consciousness prevails as the ultimate judge. There is no punishment—only realignment. Dharma is restored.
